title: Feature Request: Template connections with no hostnames
author: dachiz
body_snippet: My remote hosts frequently change but I have common credentials for all of them.  It would be terrific if I could create a template connection that has my credentials (or inherits them), and when I launch it, I'm prompted for the host to connect to.  If the connection is successful, it would then ask me if I wanted to save the connection.

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet:
This is pretty much what [Inheritance](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/wiki/Folders-and-Inheritance) does - setup a folder with all the details, then create a connection with just the hostname (generally the only thing that will be different).

Give that a shot and see if that meets your needs. If not, please provide some additional details on how/where things can be improved.

comments.author: dachiz
comments.snippet:
I use the inheritance feature a lot (thanks!).  This request is slightly different.  It's basically quick-connect with inheritance.

If you have a lot of virtual machines that frequently come and go, your saved connections become obsolete just as frequently.  So I find myself using quick-connection about as much as my saved connections.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
> It's possible that the scheduled Credential Manager functionality expected in 1.77 will also help in this regard...

That's a good point. We could add something in the quick connect control to allow you to select a credential for the connection.

> If the connection is successful, it would then ask me if I wanted to save the connection.

This would also be a decent feature by itself - convert a quick connection to a saved one.
